intro: Polyrhaphis, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, and the plants often grow in open, sunny habitats. Polyrhaphis species are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
